clinical_study.brief_title: Multimodal Imaging in the Study of Disorientation in the Hospital
clinical_study.official_title: Multimodal Imaging in Alzheimer's Disease and Other Neurodegenerative Diseases

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate whether markers of brain structure and function from MRI are associated with different levels of spatial orientation and gait parameters in people with mild cognitive impairment or dementia due to Alzheimer's disease when walking through a real world environment.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is an experimental cross-sectional study which primarily aims at identifying characteristic features of spatial disorientation among people with mild cognitive impairment and dementia. The features of interest are motion and physiological related changes that occur during instances of spatial disorientation, which will be derived from wearable sensors.
Additionally, brain structure and functional connectivity changes associated with different levels of spatial orientation and gait parameters will also be investigated through resting-state functional imaging.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 years from start of the study
primary_outcome.description: Incidences of disorientation will be annotated in real-time using a customized annotation scheme in the pocket observer software

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 years from start of the study
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of change in heart rate will be measured using a wearable Photoplethysmography sensor

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 years from start of the study
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of change in electrodermal response will be measured using a wearable electrodermal activity sensor

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 years from start of the study
secondary_outcome.description: Incidences of change in movement behaviour and activity level will be measured using accelerometers

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 years from start of the study
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of change in brain structural volume will be measured using a 3-Tesla scanner

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 years from start of the study
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of change in structural connectivity of brain white matter will be measured using a 3-Tesla scanner

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 years from start of the study
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of change in functional connectivity of resting-state brain networks will be measured using a 3-Tesla scanner

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 years from start of the study
secondary_outcome.description: Participants assessments of their sense of orientation are obtained using a structured interview.

arm_group.description: Neurologically healthy older adults above the age of 50
Older adults above the age of 50 with Mild Cognitive Impairment or Dementia

study_pop.textblock: Healthy older adults and older adults with mild cognitive impairment or dementia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 50 years and above
- Mini mental state examination (MMSE) ≥ 12 < 28 points for experimental group
- Mini mental state examination (MMSE) ≥ 28 points for control group
- Sufficient knowledge of German to understand participant information, declaration of consent and questionnaires
- Dated and signed declaration of consent
- Sufficient mobility and motivation to participate in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Less than 50 years
- Significantly impaired vision or hearing
- Severely reduced mobility: cannot move around independently (even with aids)
